meanings.definition: Making a harsh, high-pitched sound when being moved or touched.
meanings.sent1: The old door swung creakily in the wind.
meanings.sent2: The floorboards creakily announced the arrival of the cat.
meanings.sent3: The creakily protesting chair added a musical touch to the room.
meanings.sent4: The creakily whispering trees shared their secrets with the wind.
meanings.sent5: The creakily groaning stairs echoed through the empty house.

meanings.definition: In a manner that produces a harsh, high-pitched sound when moved or touched.
meanings.sent1: She walked creakily across the old wooden bridge.
meanings.sent2: The door opened creakily as if telling a spooky story.
meanings.sent3: The old bicycle moved creakily, amusing the children.
meanings.sent4: Time passed creakily, like an old clock ticking in the background.
meanings.sent5: The wind howled creakily through the cracks in the window.
